segments.text: I see the woman drying dishes, and I’m surprised she hasn’t noticed the water yet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The sink is overflowing, and she’s just standing there like nothing’s wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think she must be really distracted or just not paying attention at all.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids are being sneaky, and she has no idea what’s happening behind her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how calm she is, just polishing that plate while the water spreads everywhere.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is balancing on a wobbly stool, and she doesn’t even turn around.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like I’m watching something that shouldn’t be happening, but no one is stopping it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is waiting for a cookie, and the woman is completely missing it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish she would just look up and see what’s going on around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how unaware she is of everything happening right in front of her.
segments.speaker: PAR
